intro: Viola tricolor ramosa, commonly known as the three-color violet, is a species of flowering plant in the Violaceae family. It is characterized by its trifoliate leaves, which typically display three distinct colors—usually purple, yellow, and white. The plant produces small, showy flowers that bloom in early spring, often in shades of violet and white. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full shade. Viola tricolor ramosa is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional herbal medicine.
